text: David E. Bowles (born August 30, 1944) is an American politician from Maine. Bowles, a Republican from Sanford, served four terms (1998-2006) in the Maine House of Representatives. He served two of those terms in leadership as Assistant Minority Leader (2003-2004) and as Minority Leader (2005-2006). Bowles was born in Rochester, New York and settled in Sanford, Maine. He attended Washington and Lee University for one year and the University of Southern Maine for five years. He also served in the United States Marine Corps from 1964 to 1968. ==References== Category:1944 births Category:Living people Category:Politicians from Rochester, New York Category:People from Sanford, Maine Category:Maine Republicans Category:Minority Leaders of the Maine House of Representatives Category:United States Marines Category:Washington and Lee University alumni Category:University of Southern Maine alumni
title: David Bowles (politician)
